OLEV Documents

Thanks

Almost there! To complete your order please fill in some additional detail about your installation. This information will help us determine whether you qualify for a standard installation.

OLEV Application Form Annex D

Please fill out this form to complete your OLEV application. Note your installation date can not be scheduled until your OLEV application has been processed.

Who owns your vehicle?

Proof of vehicle ownership

Please upload a copy of your vehicle order confirmation. This is required as additional documentation for the OLEV grant as proof of vehicle purchase.

Electricity Meter Point Number

Please enter your MPAN (Meter Point Administration Number). This should be printed in the format below on a recent electricity bill. The bottom row of numbers are required, in addition to your electricity bill, they can also be found online here.

S
Finish

Questions

How long will the install take and do I need to be there at the time?

No domestic install is exactly the same so it's hard to give an exact time. But we estimate 1.5-3 hours for a standard installation. At the end of the installation your POD Point Expert will give you a demonstration of the unit and confirm you're happy with everything so it's important that you are there at the time.

Can I connect my POD Point to a plug socket?

No, in order to get a faster charge and to ensure it is properly protected we will need to connect the POD Point directly your consumer unit (fuse board) or electricity meter.

Can you install a POD Point if my parking space is away from the property?

Planning restrictions state that the charging cable from the charging unit to the car must not foul any public footpath. So it's best to send photos in advance so we can make an assessment of your property.
